meanings.definition: The act of working diligently late into the night.
meanings.sent1: Her elucubration on the project paid off with excellent results.
meanings.sent2: The writer's elucubration on the novel lasted until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent3: Despite feeling tired, his elucubration on the assignment was impressive.
meanings.sent4: The elucubration of the scientist led to a groundbreaking discovery.
meanings.sent5: The student's elucubration on the subject was evident in the thoroughness of the report.

meanings.definition: A piece of writing produced through intense study and research.
meanings.sent1: The professor's elucubration on the topic was highly praised by colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The book was a result of years of elucubration by the author.
meanings.sent3: The elucubration in the journal article was both informative and engaging.
meanings.sent4: Her elucubration on the essay was evident in the depth of analysis.
meanings.sent5: The elucubration of the poet captured the essence of the human experience.
